column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.3
#T_SP=webanno.custom.RoleAnnotation|roles
#Text=Mr.
#Text=Heller (Mexico) (spoke in Spanish): I would\r
#Text=like to thank Secretary-General Ban Ki-moon for\r
#Text=\r
#Text=joining us at this important meeting of the Security\r
#Text=Council.
#Text=We would also like to welcome to the Council\r
#Text=Chamber Mr.
#Text=Bedouma Alain Yoda, Minister for\r
#Text=Foreign Affairs of Burkina Faso, and Mr.
#Text=Alain\r
#Text=Joyandet, Minister of State for Cooperation and\r
#Text=Francophonie of France.
#Text=I would like in particular to welcome you,\r
#Text=Madam Secretary of State, and to acknowledge your\r
#Text=personal commitment and leadership, which have\r
#Text=created renewed impetus for the issue of the protection\r
#Text=of women's rights and the prevention of all forms of\r
#Text=violence against women.
#Text=My delegation would also\r
#Text=like to thank the delegation of the United States for\r
#Text=leading negotiations on resolution 1888 (2009), which\r
#Text=has just been adopted.
#Text=With the unanimous adoption of that resolution,\r
#Text=the Security Council has reaffirmed its commitment to\r
#Text=the protection of women in armed conflict.
#Text=The\r
#Text=significant number of delegations that joined in\r
#Text=sponsoring this initiative shows that the international\r
#Text=community is resolved to ensure that women and\r
#Text=children no longer remain the principal victims of the\r
#Text=armed conflicts which, deplorably, are occurring in\r
#Text=many parts of the world.
#Text=Council members were able to see for ourselves\r
#Text=the gravity of the acts of sexual violence against\r
#Text=women and children in areas of armed conflict in the\r
#Text=course of our visit to a number of African countries last\r
#Text=May, in particular the Democratic Republic of the\r
#Text=Congo.
#Text=On that occasion we witnessed the\r
#Text=consequences of these crimes for societies and their\r
#Text=negative impact on efforts to find solutions to crisis\r
#Text=situations and promote an effective process of national\r
#Text=reconciliation.
#Text=For that reason we wish to reiterate, as\r
#Text=does resolution 1888 (2009), the primary obligation of\r
#Text=all parties to an armed conflict to respect and to\r
#Text=enforce at all times international humanitarian law,\r
#Text=which grants special protection to women and children.
#Text=My delegation believes that the establishment of\r
#Text=the post of Special Representative of the Secretary-\r
#Text=General on sexual violence in situations of armed\r
#Text=conflict will make it possible to improve the systematic\r
#Text=and comprehensive attention that the United Nations\r
#Text=pays in response to sexual violence in these situations.
#Text=This new mandate should work in a coordinated\r
#Text=manner with other United Nations mechanisms and\r
#Text=agencies in order to harness synergies and to prevent\r
#Text=duplication.
#Text=In particular, there is a broad relationship\r
#Text=\r
#Text=between the objectives of resolution 1888 (2009) and\r
#Text=resolution 1882 (2009), on children and armed conflict,\r
#Text=which was adopted by the Security Council last\r
#Text=August.
#Text=These common objectives must be duly explored\r
#Text=with a view to providing comprehensive protection for\r
#Text=all those who, due to their condition, suffer most from\r
#Text=the consequences of armed conflict, that is, women and\r
#Text=children.
#Text=In the light of the aforementioned, we believe\r
#Text=that the Security Council must also pay close attention\r
#Text=to the ongoing negotiations on a composite gender\r
#Text=entity within the framework of the General Assembly\r
#Text=and decide to review the mandate of the Special\r
#Text=Representative in a reasonable period of time and in\r
#Text=the light of the results of the procedure outlined in\r
#Text=General Assembly resolution 63/311.
#Text=While more can be done at the international level\r
#Text=in order to prevent sexual violence in situations of\r
#Text=armed conflict, the eradication of sexual violence will\r
#Text=only be achieved if national capacities among those\r
#Text=States that are addressing situations of conflict are\r
#Text=improved with a view to bringing the perpetrators of\r
#Text=such crimes to justice.
#Text=Therefore, one of the most relevant aspects of the\r
#Text=resolution is the identification within the United\r
#Text=Nations of a multidisciplinary team of experts who,\r
#Text=when their assistance is required and with the consent\r
#Text=of the State concerned, can be deployed to the field in\r
#Text=order to work jointly with the Government and the\r
#Text=United Nations system to undertake projects for\r
#Text=technical cooperation to strengthen the rule of law,\r
#Text=prevent impunity and address victims' needs.
#Text=It is clear that currently we have strong tools for\r
#Text=preventing sexual violence in areas of conflict.
#Text=The\r
#Text=true challenge that we face is making full use of this\r
#Text=array of instruments, if we truly wish to ensure that\r
#Text=more women and children do not fall victim to the\r
#Text=spiral of violence that is caused by armed conflict.
